events.title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
events.description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

events.title: African Drum and Dance of Nevada County
events.description: Come join our vibrant African Drum and Dance classes! Open to all ages and abilities, we explore different styles from across the African Diasporic disciplines. Including Malian, Congolese, Guinean, Senegalese, Afro-Cuban and Afro-Brazilian. Masters of their craft travel from all over to share their culture and heritage with our beautiful community, along with our own fabulous local teachers and percussionists, to offer a truly inspiring and engaging experience

events.title: Cosplay Curious: Teen Mixed Media Art Club
events.description: Cosplay Curious: Teen Mixed Media Art Club and Creative Get Together, A bi-monthly youth art group at The Curious Forge, Come as you are. Make something bold. Meet other creative teens., This bi-monthly Teen Art Club is a welcoming, inclusive creative meetup for youth ages 14–19 who are interested in art, cosplay, mixed media, and hands-on making. Facilitated by artist Clara Frawley, this group blends art-making, skill-sharing, and community connection in a relaxed, supportive environment., Each bi-monthly meetup will blend creative warm-ups, hands-on making, and skill-building in a relaxed, social studio environment. Participants will explore drawing, design, pattern-making, and mixed-media techniques while developing personal and collaborative projects. Sessions may include playful identity-based art, wearable or sculptural forms, safe tool and material use, and opportunities for skill sharing. As the group grows, projects will evolve based on shared interests and creative curiosity., No prior experience required—just curiosity and a willingness to try something new. We take great care to create a welcoming and inclusive environment where every person can feel valued and supported., Reserve your space with Ticket. , $10 donation recommended. No one will be turned away for lack of funds.

events.title: Julie Fowlis
events.description: Julie Fowlis is a multi-award-winning Scottish singer whose pure, crystalline voice has been celebrated around the world. Raised in the Outer Hebrides and deeply rooted in Gaelic tradition, her music is shaped by the landscapes and language of the Highlands., Internationally known as the voice of Disney Pixar’s Brave, Fowlis sang the film’s iconic theme songs — one of which was long-listed for an Oscar. Her career spans acclaimed solo albums, high-profile collaborations, and performances at major venues including Carnegie Hall, the Royal Albert Hall Proms, the Philharmonie de Paris, Shakespeare’s Globe, and global events broadcast to audiences of millions., Her voice has been streamed over 120 million times, featured on a NASA astronaut playlist, and even inspired a lily named in her honor. A sought-after collaborator and presenter, she has worked across film, television, radio, and video games — including How to Train Your Dragon 3 and Assassin’s Creed Valhalla., Fowlis was named Scotland’s first National Gaelic Ambassador, holds an honorary Doctorate of Music, and continues to champion Gaelic arts on the world stage.

events.title: Nevada City Winery Gallery "SÝN" - "VISION" by Lilja Gudmundsdottir
events.description: This series vividly shows reflective water, light, boulders, plant life, banks, and rich colors, but Lilja’s talents shine in her capturing of the river’s hidden jeweled views. She does so by literally going knee deep, camera in hand exploring over, under, and around to find the mysteries of immense boulders, crevasses, cracks, or wisps of branches seemingly embracing, and reaching for a softly lit boulder. The shows runs through February 23 - the winery is open every day. www.ncwinery.com.

events.title: Playwriting Group
events.description: Sent upon request. (We meet in each other's homes.) All playwrights welcome! Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

events.title: Much Ado About Nothing
events.description: Directed By: Robert J. PetersonAdapted By: Robert J PetersonOne of Shakespeare’s greatest comedies, MUCH ADO ABOUT NOTHING follows a pair of long-feuding lovers, Benedick and Beatrice, as they trace a winding course back into each others’ arms. Meanwhile, a young couple, Claudio and Hero, plans their own marriage, only for a bitter rival, Don John, to thwart their intentions. Thankfully the local law, Dogberry and the watch, work the case and set things right. This production resets the action to 1979 New Orleans, presenting the play in a new adaptation that harvests dialogue from around the Elizabethan era. Old fans and newcomers alike should delight in this surprise-filled production. kespeare’s greatest comedies, MUCH ADO ABOUT NOTHING follows a pair of long-feuding lovers, Benedick and Beatrice, as they trace a winding course back into each others’ arms. Celebrate ASiF’s community and learn more about the powerful impact these creative hubs have within our Cultural Districts, east and west., Art in Public Spaces is a program of Nevada County Arts Council, presented in partnership with the County of Nevada., Exhibition: September 12, 2025 - February 17, 2026, Opening Reception: Friday, September 19th at 4:30pm, Where: The Eric Rood Administrative Center - 950 Maidu Ave, Nevada City

events.title: Watercolor Exploration with Chappy Valente
events.description: Immerse yourself in the expressive world of watercolor painting! Whether you’re brand new to watercolor or looking to expand your skills, this hands-on class with artist and educator Chappy Valente will help you gain confidence and technique. Learn to paint with fluidity and intention as you explore the tools, papers, and brushwork that make watercolor such a luminous and rewarding medium., Each session is a stand-alone class with fresh projects and techniques—join once or come monthly to continue growing your watercolor practice., What’s the Project:, Create your own watercolor studies exploring washes, color mixing, and texture effects. Each class introduces a new focus—such as landscapes, botanicals, or abstract forms—to inspire your creativity., What Will They Learn:, Brush control and paint-to-water ratios, Wash techniques (wet-on-wet, wet-on-dry, gradient), Paper types, brush styles, and pigment selection, Layering, and color blending, Tips for composition and adding expressive detail, Materials Needed:, All materials are provided for in-class use. Students are welcome to bring their own favorite brushes or watercolor set if desired., Skill Level / Prerequisites:, All skill levels welcome—from first-time painters to those continuing their watercolor journey., Class Length: One 3-hour session, (Optional continuing classes offered monthly), Fee: $50 + $20 materials, Minimum 3 / Maximum 6 participants

events.title: Love Lounge
events.description: Love Lounge is a Valentine’s Day gathering designed for connection, music, and being fully present—held in one thoughtfully curated space.Doors open at 6:00pm for arrival and mingling. Programming begins at 6:30pm with an opening Rose Ceremony, followed by romantic DJ sets by Ruby Chase and Deva Runa, a live acoustic Medicine Sessions performance featuring Tete Bero, Angelina Oka, and Michael Gazzo, and a series of gently curated moments designed to invite warmth, ease, and connection throughout the evening.Enjoy hand-rolled sushi by Chef Ned, craft mocktails by Soulspace, and the Red Lotus Lounge by Monrosia, featuring red lotus tea—an ancient botanical traditionally associated with relaxation and heart-opening qualities. Local vendors will be woven throughout the space, offering moments of discovery and connection.Hand-rolled sushi will be freshly prepared on-site with vegan, cooked, and traditional options available.This is a full Valentine’s experience—one place to arrive, stay awhile, and enjoy the night without needing to go anywhere else.Come solo, with a close friend, or with your beloved.This gathering is welcoming to singles and couples of all genders and orientations.Sushi RSVP InfoTo ensure availability, guests who plan to enjoy sushi are invited to reserve their spot with a $15 per-person sushi deposit, which will be applied toward their sushi order the night of the event. This helps our chef plan ahead and reduce waste.After purchasing your event ticket, you’ll receive a follow-up email with a link to reserve your sushi and place the deposit.Menu available at soulspacecollective.org/loveloungeEvent DetailsFriday, February 14Soulspace — 206 W Main St, Grass ValleyDoors: 6:00pmProgramming: 6:30pm–11:00pmTickets• $30 Presale• $35 at the door• $15 Sushi RSVP add-onFood & drinks sold separately

events.title: Cupid’s Cabaret: A Valentine’s Golden Gala
events.description: Truth or Dare Productions PresentsCupid’s Cabaret: A Valentine’s Golden Gala, This Valentine’s Day, romance meets rebellion as Cybil Unrest and Truth or Dare Productions present Cupid’s Cabaret: A Valentine’s Golden Gala, an immersive burlesque experience celebrating love, community, and golden-era glamour., Taking place Saturday, February 14, this one-night-only event transforms the beloved Golden Era Lounge into a glittering cabaret fantasy infused with modern edge and playful seduction.Wrapped in the lush, vintage elegance of Golden Era Lounge, Cupid’s Cabaret blends old-Hollywood sparkle with contemporary burlesque heat. Audiences can expect dazzling showgirls, cheeky satire, and intimate performances that blur the line between cabaret nostalgia and bold modern expression., “This night is more than just a show — it’s an experience,” says producer and host Cybil Unrest, founder of Truth or Dare Productions. “Burlesque has always been about joy, wit, community, and freedom of expression, and Cupid’s Cabaret brings all of that together in one unforgettable Valentine’s celebration., Event Highlights Include:, -Decadent golden-era–inspired burlesque performances from a lineup of sensational performers, -Two burlesque show sets with your one ticket at 8:00 PM and 9:00 PM — no two shows are alike, -A pre-show Lounge Party (6:00–8:00 PM) open to the public with no ticket required, -A special one-night-only “Truth or Dare” cocktail crafted exclusively by Golden Era Lounge, -A post-show Music Bar Party (9:30 PM–Midnight) featuring soundscapes by DJ BackPalm (Nick Fedoroff), open to the public, The evening is designed as a full Valentine’s experience, encouraging guests to arrive early, stay late, and enjoy every layer of the night — from cocktails and dancing to intimate, up-close burlesque performances. With Golden Era Lounge’s warm, historic atmosphere and famously excellent sightlines, there truly isn’t a bad seat in the house.VIP tickets offer premium front-row seating and enhanced interaction with performers, though availability is limited and expected to sell out quickly. General seating is also limited, reinforcing the intimate nature of the event., Beyond romance, Cupid’s Cabaret celebrates love in all its forms, romantic, platonic, chosen family, and community. The event is proudly LGBTQ+ friendly, welcoming all identities and orientations., Schedule at a Glance:, 6:00–8:00 PM — Lounge Party (No Ticket Required), 8:00 PM — First Burlesque Show Set (Ticket Required), 9:00 PM — Second Burlesque Show Set (Ticket Required), 9:30 PM–12:00 AM — Music Bar Party with DJ BackPalm (No Ticket Required)A limited number of door tickets may be available for walk-ups (cash or Venmo only), though advance purchase is strongly encouraged as the show historically sells out., Cupid’s Cabaret: A Valentine’s Golden Gala promises a sultry, celebratory night filled with laughter, glamour, and unforgettable live entertainment — a Valentine’s experience rooted in artistry, inclusivity, and joy.For tickets and more information, follow Truth or Dare Productions and Golden Era Lounge on social media, or go to Truth or Dare Productions .com

events.title: Woodturning 101 – Craft a Beautiful Wooden Bowl
events.description: Are you interested in woodturning and looking to learn a new skill? In this class, you’ll learn how to turn a beautiful bowl out of wood using a lathe. The process is both rewarding and relaxing, as you take a piece of raw wood and turn it into a functional work of wood art. Under the guidance of our experienced instructor, you’ll start by learning the basics of wood lathe operation and safety. Once you’re comfortable with the equipment, we’ll move on to selecting and preparing the wood for turning. With the wood secured on the lathe, you’ll use a series of specially designed tools to shape the bowl. , At the end of the class, you’ll take home a beautiful, hand-turned bowl that you can be proud of. You’ll also have the woodturning skills and knowledge to continue turning bowls on your own. , Price: $160 + $40 materials, Limited spaces available. Sign up today! Class 2 minimum/3 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled) , Tools provided. If you have tools, please feel free to bring them.

events.title: American Piano Awards Winner: Michael Davidman presented by InConcert Sierra
events.description: Michael Davidman, American Piano Awards Winner, February 15, 2026 ∙ 2pm, with 1:15 pre-concert forum, Davidman is the grand prize winner of the 2025 American Piano Awards and the prestigious Christel DeHaan Fellowship. He was awarded $25,000 and will also receive over $200,000 in career support, including two years of artist management and public relations services, a media tour, a residency at the University of Indianapolis, a recording contract with the Steinway & Sons label, and numerous performance opportunities both in the United States and abroad., Following his remarkable performance of Sergei Rachmaninoff’s Piano Concerto No. 3 in D minor, Op. 30, Davidman was awarded first place in the competition. As the top prize winner (the 50th winner of the competition since it began 1979), he will also embark on a recital tour during the 2026–27 season, along with concert engagements with the American Piano Award’s partners, including the Phoenix Symphony, Santa Fe Symphony Orchestra, Tucson Symphony Orchestra, Buffalo Philharmonic Orchestra, Indianapolis Symphony Orchestra, and chamber recital with InConcert Sierra., A graduate of the Curtis Institute and Juilliard, Davidman is currently studying with Stanislav Ioudenitch at the Reina Sofía School of Music in Madrid. He is a winner of the Long-Thibaud International Piano Competition, the Juilliard Gina Bachauer Competition, and the Ithaca College of Music Piano Competition, and has performed as a soloist with the Philadelphia Orchestra, Orchestre Symphonique de la Garde Républicaine, Symphonicity, and the Monterey Symphony.

events.title: Punch-Drunk Love
events.description: Struggling to cope with his erratic temper, novelty-toilet-plunger salesman Barry Egan (Adam Sandler, demonstrating remarkable versatility in his first dramatic role) spends his days collecting frequent-flier-mile coupons and dodging the insults of his seven sisters. The promise of a new life emerges when Barry inadvertently attracts the affection of a mysterious woman named Lena (Emily Watson), but their budding relationship is threatened when he falls prey to the swindling operator of a phone sex line and her deranged boss (played with maniacal brio by Philip Seymour Hoffman). Fueled by the careening momentum of a baroque-futurist score by Jon Brion, the Cannes-award-winning PUNCH-DRUNK LOVE channels the spirit of classic Hollywood and the whimsy of Jacques Tati into an idiosyncratic ode to the delirium of new romance.

events.title: Joss Stone
events.description: Wednesday, February 18, 2026, Doors: 6pm | Show: 7pm, The Center for the Arts | 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, Tickets: Reserved Seating, Genre: R&B, Joss Stone is a Grammy and Brit Award-winning artist who released her acclaimed debut album, The Soul Sessions, in 2003, at the age of 16. Over her career, she has released ninestudio albums, selling over 15 million copies worldwide. Stone has performed and collaborated with legendary artists including James Brown, BurtBacharach, Stevie Wonder, Gladys Knight, Sting, Van Morrison, Melissa Etheridge, Jeff Beck, Mick Jagger, and Damien Marley, amassing over one billion streams in the US alone.In 2014, she completed her audacious Total World Tour, performing and collaborating withlocal artists and charities in every country in the world.Her 2022 release, Never Forget My Love, was her eighth studio album, written with and produced by Eurythmics’ Dave Stewart, with whom she also co-wrote music and lyrics for the West End musical The Time Traveller’s Wife. In 2023, Stone embarked on her "20 Years of Soul" anniversary tour, during which she recorded her first live album, 20 Years of Soul - Live in Concert. She followed this with the Ellipsis Tour in 2024. Her latest single, "Loving You," was released on August 9, 2024. Stone is currently working on a new studio album, scheduled for release in 2025.

events.title: NU Dance 25th Annual Student Choreography Showcase
events.description: Nevada Union High School’s Theatrical Dance program proudly presents the 25th annual Student Choreography Showcase on Thursday, February 19th through Saturday, February 21st at 7:00 p.m. at the Don Baggett Theater, 11761 Ridge Road, Grass Valley. Twenty student choreographers have created dances in a variety of styles, taught to their peers in after-school and weekend rehearsals. Junior Tabby Gillespie is choreographing for the first time this year, and she chose “Benny and the Jets” by Elton John. Reflecting on her song choice, Gillespie said, “I want to share a positive vibe with the audience, conveying that dance doesn’t need to be taken so seriously. I wanted to choreograph this piece because dance has always been a place where I can be myself and has shaped me as a person.” Senior Eryn Miller has been in the Advanced Dance class for all four years of high school, and this is her third year choreographing for Showcase. This year, she is choreographing two dances: one for the intermediate class and one for a group of her advanced peers. Her advanced piece is a tribute to her grandmother, who passed away a few years ago. She titled her piece, “For Grammy,” explaining, “I will forever know the love she felt for my dancing and the pride she felt when I stepped on stage. I dance not just for myself, but to feel the everlasting love she had for my dance. I know she would be proud of the young dancer I am becoming. I want to honor her memory and give thanks to who she was.” Junior Charlotte des Tombe composed an original song for her dance, combining her love for dance as well as songwriting. Her piece explores the theme of coping with loss, and she titled her song as well as her dance “Blue Eyes.” Senior Advanced Dancer and Theatrical Dance Club President, Annie Armstrong, choreographed two dances for this show: one for a Beginning Dance class, and one for Advanced. Both of her dances reflect her transition from childhood to adulthood and her experiences over the past four years in the NU Dance Program. In her choreography proposal, Armstrong wrote, “This program has been like a home to me, and I am grateful for my friends and the connections I have made here.” This annual production is an audience favorite. It began as a senior project twenty-four years ago, when current dance teacher, Courtney Wadman, was a senior in the advanced dance class. Wadman, along with some of her fellow dancers, wanted to create a production of student works, so under the guidance of their teacher Yelena Holt, the Student Choreography Showcase became an annual tradition. Tickets are $15 and all seating is reserved. Tickets can be purchased online at www.nevadauniondance.com…. Online sales close at 10:00 a.m. the morning of the performance to prepare the box office. Remaining tickets will be sold at the box office, cash or check only, beginning 2 hours before each performance. For additional information, contact the Nevada Union Dance Department at (530) 273-4431 ext. 2103 or email nuhsdance@gmail.com.

events.title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
events.description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

events.title: Nature Infused Bookmaking Journey
events.description: Handcrafted Journals & Storybooks Using Natural Materials and Time-Honored Binding Techniques, Slow down, work with your hands, and create something meaningful., In this multi-session workshop, participants will explore the art of handmade bookmaking using fine art paper, handmade papers, natural materials, fabric, leather, collage, and traditional binding techniques. We’ll begin with small, playful book forms, move into nature-inspired bindings, and culminate in a beautifully stitched Artist Journal or Artist Storybook., This workshop blends artisan craft with gentle guided creative exploration, offering a welcoming space to quiet the mind through introspection and hands-on making. Books become containers for story, memory, and creative intention — pieces you can continue working in long after the class ends., No previous bookbinding experience is required. All materials are provided., What you’ll create:, 2–3 small handmade books using folded and pre-bound structures, 1–2 nature-inspired bound books, A final Artist Journal or Artist Storybook using sewn binding techniques, Format:, 4–session series | 3 hours per session, Class Size: 6–10 participants, Session Fee: $245 + Materials Fee: $45

events.title: Flameworking Everything Marbles
events.description: Lampworking: Everything Marbles!, Small spheres. Big satisfaction., Are the kids still playing marbles and jacks? Maybe… maybe not—but in this class, marbles take center stage. Everything Marbles! is a playful, hands-on lampworking workshop where participants of all ages and experience levels learn the fundamentals of making beautiful, handmade glass marbles on the torch., This class is all about building strong foundations while having fun. You’ll explore how molten glass gathers, moves, and responds to heat and gravity as you shape, color, and finish your own unique marbles. Along the way, we’ll also demystify the annealing process and why it’s essential to creating strong, finished glass pieces., Whether you’re brand new to lampworking or looking to expand your skills, this class offers a welcoming entry point into torchwork—and a great way to start (or grow) a marble collection made entirely by you., What You’ll Create, Clear glass marbles, Outside-color marbles, Inside-color marbles, What You’ll Learn, Basic heat control on the torch, Gathering and shaping molten glass, Applying color inside and outside the marble, Gravity and marvering techniques, How to use a marble mold, An introduction to annealing and the cooling process, Class Details, Skill Level: All levels welcome (no prior experience required), Format: One hands-on workshop, Ages: Adults & Teens 12 +, Class Size: Small-group instruction for personalized guidance, Materials: All glass and tools provided, Please wear natural fiber clothing (cotton, wool, etc.), Bring a snack and water for break time, Price: $75 class fee + $30 materials, Perfect for curious beginners, young makers, and anyone who loves small-scale glass magic, Everything Marbles! is a fun, approachable way to experience lampworking while creating timeless glass treasures—one marble at a time.

events.title: Kathleen Edwards
events.description: Kathleen Edwards is a powerhouse of alt-country and Americana - wry, soulful, and unflinchingly real. Known for her sharp lyrics and heartfelt delivery, she’s been praised by The New York Times for her “droll, observant and unsparing tone,” and hailed by Rolling Stone as “devastatingly great.”, On stage, Edwards channels the grit of Lucinda Williams, the candor of Brandi Carlile, and the poetic edge of Jason Isbell. With multiple JUNO and Americana Award nominations and the SOCAN Songwriting Prize to her name, she’s a storyteller whose songs hit deep - intimate, raw, and irresistibly alive.

events.title: Ukulele for the People

Twenty or so seniors showed up for the first class. Fifteen or so continued. Today there are nearly 75 members on its email list. events.title: Youth Maker XD Ceramics Handbuilding Fun – Afterschool Workshop
events.description: Youth Maker XD Ceramics Handbuilding Fun – with Candace Tkachenko, Come play with clay!, In this fun and interactive class, students will create ceramic pottery using clay and their imagination! Handbuilding allows participants to learn how to press decorative designs into clay for unique one of kind pottery pieces. Student will learn to to roll clay on the slab roller, design, cut, and decorate their piece with a variety of textures. Pieces will be bisque fired and then the glazing fun begins., You will be notified to pick you your child’s ceramic pieces after they have been glaze fired, approximately 10 days after the last class., Our classes are designed to be both fun and educational, with experienced instructors who are passionate about sharing their skills and knowledge with young people. We take great care to create a welcoming and inclusive environment where every child can feel valued and supported., Ages 8 +, 4 class series – 4:00 – 5:30 pm each Monday Afternoon, $150 ($120 + $30 materials), Class 5 minimum/6 maximum participants

events.title: Playwriting Group
events.description: Sent upon request. (We meet in each other's homes.) All playwrights welcome! Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

events.title: Enameling Jewelry Pendants – Mingle and Make
events.description: Mingle and Make –Enameling Jewelry Pendants, Price: $40 plus $20 materials per person, Bring a friend and receive a $5 off coupon toward your next class!, Join us for an evening of fun creating an enameled pendant. Using torches and colored glass powders, we will apply the enamel to copper forms and heat them until the enamels fuse to the copper. We will also be texturing another layer of the pendant with hammers or punches, and using that as a background to the enamel. This is an opportunity to see how colors work together on metal, socialize and share snacks and drinks, and come away with a beautiful and unique pendant that you have made!, Whether you’re a seasoned artist or a complete beginner, this class is perfect for anyone looking to explore their artistic side and create something truly special., So, grab a friend or come solo for a fun-filled evening of mingling, and creating, not to mention enjoying a few snacks and beverages too!, Min: 8 / Max: 12 participants (please note: if attendance does not meet the minimum, this class will be rescheduled), What is Mingle and Make?, Mingle and Make events are for adults. Join us once a month for drinks and creativity! Meet new people, and make new friends, in a casual setting as you create your own personal masterpiece. Each class will feature a unique DIY project from fusing glass, forging rings, sculpting clay, and more! Tickets include instruction, a guided activity, and supplies plus a complimentary drink. No prior experience is needed., Funds for our Mingle and Make Program are provided through the County of Nevada’s American Rescue Plan Act allocation for Community & Economic Resiliency.

events.title: Woodturning 101 – Craft a Beautiful Wooden Bowl
events.description: Discover the art of woodturning and learn to make a beautiful wood bowl using a wood lathe – no experience is required!, Are you interested in woodturning and looking to learn a new skill? In this class, you’ll learn how to turn a beautiful bowl out of wood using a lathe. The process is both rewarding and relaxing, as you take a piece of raw wood and turn it into a functional work of wood art. Under the guidance of our experienced instructor, you’ll start by learning the basics of wood lathe operation and safety. Once you’re comfortable with the equipment, we’ll move on to selecting and preparing the wood for turning. With the wood secured on the lathe, you’ll use a series of specially designed tools to shape the bowl. , At the end of the class, you’ll take home a beautiful, hand-turned bowl that you can be proud of. You’ll also have the woodturning skills and knowledge to continue turning bowls on your own. , Price: $160 + $40 materials, Limited spaces available. Sign up today! Class 2 minimum/3 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled) , Tools provided. If you have tools, please feel free to bring them.

events.title: Nevada City Chinese Lunar New Year Parade and Festival
events.venue_name: Commercial Street in Nevada City and at the Miners Foundry.
events.description: The community parade begins at 12:00 noon from the bottom of the Chinese Quarter on Commercial Street (Robinson Plaza) in Nevada City, where revelers may line up. After the Lion Dancing outdoor performance on Spring Street, more entertainment, exhibits, and fun will take place inside the Miners Foundry beginning at 1:00 p.m. Free admission. We thank the Miners Foundry, the Nevada City Chamber of Commerce, the City of Nevada City, and the Nevada City Arts Council for their collaboration., Our parade Grand Marshals are Susan Levitz and Pascale Fusshoeller, founders of YubaNet.com, who have been staunch supporters of CATS and a great asset and news source to the community. , Parade units include the audience favorite -- Chinese ceremonial Lion Dancers and a 72’ Chinese Dragon from Eastern Ways Martial Arts of Sacramento -- second and third graders from Bell Hill Academy, “Mulan,” (aka Lily Emmolo), members of Grass Valley Aikikai martial arts, theatre groups, and other community entries. Food vendors at the Miners Foundry are Kaliko’s Hawaiian Kitchen and Gold Rush Cookies. There will be Asian-themed arts and crafts and gifts for sale, a kid’s table, mahjong, a new children’s Chinese New Year book launch and sale by Allison Chan, face painting with Chinese horoscope tattoos, Chinese tea ceremony demonstrations, Rose Murphy from the Nevada County Historical Society promoting free self-guided historic walking tours of the Grass Valley and Nevada City Chinatowns, Lisa Redfern and Rose Murphy showing their film, "Chinese Family Stories - From Exclusion to Pillars of the Community," community vendors and more. We are seeking parade entries, entertainers, vendors, exhibitors, sponsors, and lots of volunteers. Contact Jeannie Wood at info@catsweb.org

events.title: The Rocket Man
events.description: Presented by The Center for the Arts , Tuesday, March 3, 2026, Doors: 6pm | Show: 7pm, The Center for the Arts | 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, Tickets: Reserved Seating , , Genre: Tribute, Attention Elton John fans! Moon Coin Productions (Producers of ABBA Tribute “ABRA Cadabra” and Eagles Tribute “Take It To The Limit”) Presents The Rocket Man – A Tribute to Elton John from Vancouver performing in Grass Valley for the 1st time on March 3, 2026., Don't miss this usually and musically captivating stage production led by accomplished Vocalist, Pianist and Star Performer Sean Trombley who gives a genuine & powerful Tribute to the music that inspired him as a vocalist and musician. Sean’s stunning vocals capture the essence of Elton John at the height of his vocal power and range in the 1970’s and he brings these beautiful songs to life in a way that touches the soul and uplifts the heart. Backed by a spectacular live band, multi-media, dazzling costumes and captivating dancers, this high-energy cast of performers will transport you back in time and have you moving, smiling and singing along to all of Elton John’s most iconic hits including Rocket Man, Crocodile Rock, Benny & The Jets, Tiny Dancer, Your Song, Saturday Night’s Alright, Philadelphia Freedom, Good-bye Yellow brick Road, Daniel, Candle In The Wind and countless others! A must see show if you love the music of Elton John!

events.title: Flameworking Implosion Marbles
events.description: Flameworking Implosion Marbles –, Prerequisite: prior flameworking class or experience, Discover the magic hidden inside molten glass., In this flameworking series, participants will dive into the mesmerizing world of implosion marbles—where heat, gravity, and precision come together to create intricate 3D designs suspended inside solid glass. Working on the torch, you’ll learn how to carefully control molten glass as surface designs are drawn inward, forming layered, dimensional patterns within a perfectly shaped marble., Across three hands-on sessions, you’ll explore multiple implosion styles while refining your heat control, shaping skills, and surface decoration techniques. This class is both technical and awe-inspiring, offering plenty of “how did that just happen?” moments as glass seemingly moves on its own., What You’ll Create, Solid glass marbles, Frit implosion marbles, Firework implosion marbles, Flower implosion marbles, What You’ll Learn, Advanced heat control on the torch, Imploding solid glass to create 3D internal designs, Shaping and finishing marbles, Drawing and layering color on the glass surface, How to harness the magic of glass movement, Class Details, Skill Level: prior flameworking class or experience required, Format: 3-session series | 3 hours per session, Dates: Saturdays — 3/7, 3/14, and 3/21, Time: 1:00–4:00 PM, Ages: Adults & Teens 12+, Class Size: Maximum of 6 participants, Price: $225 + $60 materials fee, Additional Notes, Please wear natural fiber clothing (cotton, wool, etc.), Bring a snack and water for break time, Whether you’re fascinated by technical glasswork or drawn to the visual drama of implosions, this class offers a deep dive into one of flameworking’s most captivating techniques—leaving you with beautiful, mind-bending marbles and sharpened torch skills to match.

events.title: Grand Illusion (La grande illusion)
events.description: In 1917, in a German camp, a group of French prisoners - including Captain de Boëldieu (Pierre Fresnay) and Lieutenants Maréchal (Jean Gabin) and Rosenthal (Marcel Dalio) - prepare to escape. At the last moment, they are moved to a fortress commanded by German aristocrat von Rauffenstein (Eric von Stroheim), who becomes friendly with Boëldieu. One of the very first prison escape movies, GRAND ILLUSION is considered Jean Renoir’s antiwar masterpiece, and one of the greatest films ever made. IN FRENCH W/ ENGLISH SUBTITLES

events.title: Playwriting Group

Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

It’s part tasting tour, part downtown crawl, and all about savoring the best of the Foothills—one delicious stop at a time.

events.title: Watercolor Exploration with Chappy Valente
events.description: Immerse yourself in the expressive world of watercolor painting! Whether you’re brand new to watercolor or looking to expand your skills, this hands-on class with artist and educator Chappy Valente will help you gain confidence and technique. Learn to paint with fluidity and intention as you explore the tools, papers, and brushwork that make watercolor such a luminous and rewarding medium., Each session is a stand-alone class with fresh projects and techniques—join once or come monthly to continue growing your watercolor practice., What’s the Project:, Create your own watercolor studies exploring washes, color mixing, and texture effects. Each class introduces a new focus—such as landscapes, botanicals, or abstract forms—to inspire your creativity., What Will They Learn:, Brush control and paint-to-water ratios, Wash techniques (wet-on-wet, wet-on-dry, gradient), Paper types, brush styles, and pigment selection, Layering, and color blending, Tips for composition and adding expressive detail, Materials Needed:, All materials are provided for in-class use. Students are welcome to bring their own favorite brushes or watercolor set if desired., Skill Level / Prerequisites:, All skill levels welcome—from first-time painters to those continuing their watercolor journey., Class Length:, One 3-hour session, (Optional continuing classes offered monthly), Fee: $50 + $20 materials, Minimum 3 / Maximum 6 participants

events.title: Frisson presented by InConcert Sierra
events.description: FRISSON, March 15, 2026 ∙ 2pm, with 1:15 pre-concert forum, Frisson is a dynamic chamber ensemble based in New York City, celebrated for its vibrant performances and innovative programming. Under the artistic direction of oboist Thomas Gallant, the group features a rotating roster of exceptional young musicians, many of whom are alumni of prestigious institutions like Juilliard, Yale, and the Manhattan School of Music ., The ensemble's name, "Frisson," meaning "a shiver or thrill" in French, encapsulates their mission to deliver exhilarating musical experiences. Their repertoire spans a wide range, from classical masterworks to contemporary compositions, often arranged for unique instrument combinations. Frisson's flexible ensemble structure allows them to perform in various configurations, including quintets, sextets, nonets, and even a small chamber orchestra ., They will include Prokofiev's "Peter and the Wolf" narrated by our production manager Micah Cone, who is also a noted local actor, voted the "Best Local Performer" of 2024!

events.title: Glenn Miller Orchestra
events.description: The most popular and sought after big band in the world today for both concert and swing dance engagements. With its unique jazz sound, the Glenn Miller Orchestra is considered to be one of the greatest bands of all time. The present Glenn Miller Orchestra was formed in 1956 and has been touring worldwide ever since.

events.title: Fogelberg Revisited – A Tribute to Dan Fogelberg

Produced and performed by Paul Michael Costa, the show features special guest performances by Kimberly Bass and Sheldon Felich, with opening guests The Dolli Mamas. Doors 3 PM | Show 4 PM , A no-host full bar and refreshments will be available , Bring your printed ticket or QR code for entry , Expect memorable performances, inspired arrangements, and a warm community atmosphere in historic downtown Nevada City. Presented in loving memory of friend and musical partner Paul Godwin.

events.title: The Rules of the Game (La Regle du jeu) (1939)
events.description: THE RULES OF THE GAME is a scathing critique of corrupt French society cloaked in a comedy of manners, in which a weekend at a marquis’s country château lays bare some ugly truths about a group of haut-bourgeois acquaintances. The film has had a tumultuous history: it was subjected to cuts after the violent response of the audience at its 1939 premiere, and the original negative was destroyed during World War II; it wasn’t reconstructed until 1959. That version, which has stunned viewers for decades, will be presented at the Onyx Downtown on March 15th! IN FRENCH W/ ENGLISH SUBTITLES

events.title: Rashomon Dinner Movie Fundraiser
events.description: As a prelude to the upcoming stage production of RASHOMON, Community Asian Theatre of the Sierra (CATS) and The Onyx Downtown are co-presenting a special screening of Akira Kurosawa’s acclaimed 1950 film at the Nevada Theatre, starring Toshirô Mifune. This fundraiser for CATS is presented as a “Bento Box Dinner and Movie.” Guests will have the option to purchase a bento box dinner from Kaliko’s Hawaiian Kitchen food truck, parked outside the Nevada Theatre, and enjoy their meal inside the theatre. Before the screening, there will be a Japanese sword fight demonstration. Following the film, Sonny Alforque, director of the stage production, will lead a brief talk exploring how Kurosawa’s film is interpreted and reimagined for the stage. This special screening offers a thoughtful introduction to the live theatrical performance of RASHOMON, which runs April 23 – May 16 at the Nevada Theatre. Tickets at www.theonyxtheatre.com.

This fundraiser for CATS is presented as a “Bento Box Dinner and Movie.” Guests will have the option to purchase a bento box from Kaliko’s Hawaiian Kitchen food truck, parked outside the Nevada Theatre, and enjoy their meal inside the theatre. events.title: The Gipsy Kings ft. Tonino Baliardo
events.description: Tonino Baliardo is the founder and leader of Gipsy Kings, but above all he is a guitar virtuoso and a composer recognized worldwide. He composed and produced the greatest hits of the group such as “Bamboleo”or “Djobi Djoba”.Undisputed masters of gypsy music, the group has sold over 20 million albums worldwide and has been awarded numerous gold, platinum and diamond discs, a music victory in 1990 and a Grammy Award in 2013 in the Best World Music category for the album “Savor Flamenco”. He also collaborated on the film “The Big Lebowski”by remixing “Hotel California”, and on “Toy Story III”, the Disney Pixar animated film with “You’ve Got a Friend in Me”.Most recently Tonino was awarded a platinum record for his duet with Takagi Ketra and a triple platinum record with “Ingobernable”in a duet with Tangana.He has performed in the most prestigious concert halls around the world: Radio City in New York, the Hollywood Bowl or the Greek Theater in Los Angeles, but also the Royal Albert Hall in London or the Olympia in Paris. Tonino said in an interview “We started in Saint Tropez with our guitars and since then, we have travelled around the world. Music has no borders and our music is universal”. This must be the secret to 30 years of success: an eternity in the world of music. If the story written by the Gipsy Kings and Tonino Baliardo draws its sources from the gypsy tradition, it is resolutely geared towards the future and targets all generations.Family and transmission are essential values in the eyes of Tonino who has been accompanied by his two sons Mikaël and Cosso Baliardo since 2014.Today, he continues to travel the world to share a music which is unique to him.

Level 2 – Curved Cuts, Prerequisite: Intro to Stained Glass Level 1 or equivalent stained glass class at The Curious Forge, Take your stained glass skills to the next level! This Level 2 class focuses on mastering curved and inside cuts using the techniques learned in Level 1. You’ll refine your cutting, shaping, and assembly skills while creating a beautiful curved suncatcher approximately 5″ in diameter. Students must be comfortable making straight cuts before taking this class, A materials cost of $20 is required on the day. Payment to the facilitator can be made using cash or Venmo., What You’ll Learn:, How to confidently cut inside and outside curves, Techniques for grinding and fitting curved glass pieces, Tips for designing and laying out curved patterns, Review soldering techniques for curved seams, How to assemble and finish a multi-piece curved glass project, Details:, Duration: 3 hours, Price: $79 class fee + plus additional material fee $20 is required during class. Payment to the facilitator can be made using cash or Venmo., Ages: Adults and 16+, Participants: Minimum of 3, maximum of 6 (Class will be rescheduled if minimum attendance is not met) Please note: All classes require a minimum number of participants and may be rescheduled if that minimum is not met. If this happens, we’ll let you know in advance and work with you to get you into the next available class., Join us for this creative journey and leave with your own stunning stained glass suncatcher!

events.title: Dirty Cello: High-Voltage Strings at Church Street
events.description: Dirty Cello brings its high-energy, genre-defying sound to the Church Street Concert Series on Saturday, March 21, 2026 at 7:00 PM, performing live at the historic Grass Valley United Methodist Church. Led by dynamic cellist Rebecca Roudman, Dirty Cello transforms the cello into a powerful lead instrument, blending blues, rock, Americana, bluegrass, and roots music into an exciting and soulful live experience. Known for their infectious stage presence and musical versatility, the band delivers performances that are engaging, joyful, and full of surprises, appealing to audiences of all ages and musical tastes. , This concert offers a rare opportunity to hear world-class musicianship in an intimate and welcoming setting. The Church Street Concert Series is celebrated for pairing outstanding artists with a space where sound, community, and connection come together. Dirty Cello’s music ranges from foot-stomping grooves to expressive, emotional passages, creating a night that invites listeners to tap their feet, smile, and fully immerse themselves in the moment.

events.title: Leila and the Wolves
events.description: 3/22 - A film unlike any other, Heiny Srour’s LEILA AND THE WOLVES draws on the Arab heritage of oral tradition and mosaic pattern to combine fictional drama, archival footage, and fantasy sequences that explore the collective memory of Arab women and their hidden role in history throughout the past half-century in Palestine and Lebanon. This anti-colonial, narrative-documentary was filmed over seven years with women from Lebanon and Palestine, capturing the intersectionality of the struggles women faced in occupied Palestine. The character of Leila (Nabila Zeitouni) travels through time, from the British Mandate of Palestine to the Israeli invasion of Lebanon in 1982, to blend memory and myth. IN ARABIC W/ ENGLISH SUBTITLES

We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.
